byline.contributor: Susan Abad contributed reporting from Bogotá, Colombia, and Shuaib Almosawa from Sana, Yemen.
byline.original: By EMILY B. HAGER and MARK MAZZETTI

abstract: United Arab Emirates deploys 450 Latin American mercenaries to fight in Yemen; troops are taken from around 1,800 soldiers, primarily from Colombia, that have been training at secret Emirati base since 2010; move is indicative of future of warfare as rich countries seek greater military influence than their own armies can provide and private military industry expands worldwide.
lead_paragraph: The arrival in Yemen of 450 Latin American troops adds a volatile new element in a complex proxy war that has drawn in the United States and Iran.

headline.main: Emirates Secretly Sends Colombian Mercenaries to Yemen Fight
headline.print_headline: Emirates Secretly Sends Colombian Mercenaries to Yemen Fight

snippet: The arrival in Yemen of 450 Latin American troops adds a volatile new element in a complex proxy war that has drawn in the United States and Iran.
